trans-unit.source: Move Data to or from Azure Blob Storage using SSIS connectors | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Move Data to or from Azure Blob Storage using SSIS connectors | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Move Data to or from Azure Blob Storage using SSIS connectors.
trans-unit.target: Move Data to or from Azure Blob Storage using SSIS connectors.

trans-unit.source: Move Data to or from Azure Blob Storage using SSIS connectors
trans-unit.target: Move Data to or from Azure Blob Storage using SSIS connectors

trans-unit.source: The [SQL Server Integration Services Feature Pack for Azure](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt146770.aspx) provides components to connect to Azure, transfer data between Azure and on-premises data sources, and process data stored in Azure.
trans-unit.target: The [SQL Server Integration Services Feature Pack for Azure](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt146770.aspx) provides components to connect to Azure, transfer data between Azure and on-premises data sources, and process data stored in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Guidance on technologies used to move data to and/or from Azure Blob storage are linked here:
trans-unit.target: Guidance on technologies used to move data to and/or from Azure Blob storage are linked here:

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: Once customers have moved on-premises data into the cloud, they can access it from any Azure service to leverage the full power of the suite of Azure technologies.
trans-unit.target: Once customers have moved on-premises data into the cloud, they can access it from any Azure service to leverage the full power of the suite of Azure technologies.

trans-unit.source: It may be used, for example, in Azure Machine Learning or on an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: It may be used, for example, in Azure Machine Learning or on an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: This will typically be the first step for the [SQL](machine-learning-data-science-process-sql-walkthrough.md) and [HDInsight](machine-learning-data-science-process-hive-walkthrough.md) walkthroughs.
trans-unit.target: This will typically be the first step for the [SQL](machine-learning-data-science-process-sql-walkthrough.md) and [HDInsight](machine-learning-data-science-process-hive-walkthrough.md) walkthroughs.

trans-unit.source: For a discussion of canonical scenarios that use SSIS to accomplish business needs common in hybrid data integration scenarios, see [Doing more with SQL Server Integration Services Feature Pack for Azure](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ssis/archive/2015/06/25/doing-more-with-sql-server-integration-services-feature-pack-for-azure.aspx) blog.
trans-unit.target: For a discussion of canonical scenarios that use SSIS to accomplish business needs common in hybrid data integration scenarios, see [Doing more with SQL Server Integration Services Feature Pack for Azure](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ssis/archive/2015/06/25/doing-more-with-sql-server-integration-services-feature-pack-for-azure.aspx) blog.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For a complete introduction to Azure blob storage, please refer to [Azure Blob Basics](../storage-dotnet-how-to-use-blobs.md) and [Azure Blob Service](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dd179376.aspx).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For a complete introduction to Azure blob storage, please refer to [Azure Blob Basics](../storage-dotnet-how-to-use-blobs.md) and [Azure Blob Service](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dd179376.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To perform the tasks described in this article, you must have an Azure subscription and an Azure storage account set up.
trans-unit.target: To perform the tasks described in this article, you must have an Azure subscription and an Azure storage account set up.

trans-unit.source: You must know your Azure storage account name and account key in order to upload or download data.
trans-unit.target: You must know your Azure storage account name and account key in order to upload or download data.

trans-unit.source: To set up an **Azure subscription**, see [Free one-month trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: To set up an **Azure subscription**, see [Free one-month trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: For instructions on creating a **storage account** and for getting account and key information, see [About Azure storage accounts](../storage-create-storage-account.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on creating a **storage account** and for getting account and key information, see [About Azure storage accounts](../storage-create-storage-account.md).

trans-unit.source: To use the **SSIS connectors** you must download:
trans-unit.target: To use the **SSIS connectors** you must download:

trans-unit.source: **SQL Server 2014 or 2016 Standard (or above)**: Install includes includes SQL Server Integration Services.
trans-unit.target: **SQL Server 2014 or 2016 Standard (or above)**: Install includes includes SQL Server Integration Services.

trans-unit.source: **Microsoft SQL Server 2014 or 2016 Integration Services Feature Pack for Azure**: These can be downloaded, respectively, from the [SQL Server 2014 Integration Services](http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=47366) and [SQL Server 2016 Integration Services](https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=49492) pages.
trans-unit.target: **Microsoft SQL Server 2014 or 2016 Integration Services Feature Pack for Azure**: These can be downloaded, respectively, from the [SQL Server 2014 Integration Services](http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=47366) and [SQL Server 2016 Integration Services](https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=49492) pages.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] SSIS is installed with SQL Server, but is not included in the Express version.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] SSIS is installed with SQL Server, but is not included in the Express version.

trans-unit.source: For information on what applications are included in various editions of SQL Server, see [SQL Server Editions](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/server-cloud/products/sql-server-editions/)
trans-unit.target: For information on what applications are included in various editions of SQL Server, see [SQL Server Editions](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/server-cloud/products/sql-server-editions/)

trans-unit.source: For training materials on SSIS, see [Hands On Training for SSIS](http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=20766)
trans-unit.target: For training materials on SSIS, see [Hands On Training for SSIS](http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=20766)

trans-unit.source: For information on how to get up-and-running using SISS to build simple extraction, transformation, and load (ETL) packages, see [SSIS Tutorial: Creating a Simple ETL Package](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms169917.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For information on how to get up-and-running using SISS to build simple extraction, transformation, and load (ETL) packages, see [SSIS Tutorial: Creating a Simple ETL Package](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms169917.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Download NYC Taxi dataset
trans-unit.target: Download NYC Taxi dataset

trans-unit.source: The example described here use a publicly available dataset -- the [NYC Taxi Trips](http://www.andresmh.com/nyctaxitrips/) dataset.
trans-unit.target: The example described here use a publicly available dataset -- the [NYC Taxi Trips](http://www.andresmh.com/nyctaxitrips/) dataset.

trans-unit.source: The dataset consists of about 173 million taxi rides in NYC in the year 2013.
trans-unit.target: The dataset consists of about 173 million taxi rides in NYC in the year 2013.

trans-unit.source: There are two types of data : trip details data and fare data.
trans-unit.target: There are two types of data : trip details data and fare data.

trans-unit.source: As there is a file for each month, we have 24 files in all, each of which is approximately 2GB uncompressed.
trans-unit.target: As there is a file for each month, we have 24 files in all, each of which is approximately 2GB uncompressed.

trans-unit.source: Upload data to Azure blob storage
trans-unit.target: Upload data to Azure blob storage

trans-unit.source: To move data using the SSIS feature pack from on-premises to Azure blob storage, we use an instance of the [**Azure Blob Upload Task**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt146776.aspx), shown below:
trans-unit.target: To move data using the SSIS feature pack from on-premises to Azure blob storage, we use an instance of the [**Azure Blob Upload Task**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt146776.aspx), shown below:

trans-unit.source: ![configure-data-science-vm](./media/machine-learning-data-science-move-data-to-azure-blob-using-ssis/ssis-azure-blob-upload-task.png)
trans-unit.target: ![configure-data-science-vm](./media/machine-learning-data-science-move-data-to-azure-blob-using-ssis/ssis-azure-blob-upload-task.png)

trans-unit.source: The parameters that the task uses are described here:
trans-unit.target: The parameters that the task uses are described here:

trans-unit.source: Field
trans-unit.target: Field

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: **AzureStorageConnection**
trans-unit.target: **AzureStorageConnection**

trans-unit.source: Specifies an existing Azure Storage Connection Manager or creates a new one that refers to an Azure storage account that points to where the blob files are hosted.
trans-unit.target: Specifies an existing Azure Storage Connection Manager or creates a new one that refers to an Azure storage account that points to where the blob files are hosted.

trans-unit.source: **BlobContainer**
trans-unit.target: **BlobContainer**

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the blob container that will hold the uploaded files as blobs.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the blob container that will hold the uploaded files as blobs.

trans-unit.source: **BlobDirectory**
trans-unit.target: **BlobDirectory**

trans-unit.source: Specifies the blob directory where the uploaded file will be stored as a block blob.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the blob directory where the uploaded file will be stored as a block blob.

trans-unit.source: The blob directory is a virtual hierarchical structure.
trans-unit.target: The blob directory is a virtual hierarchical structure.

trans-unit.source: If the blob already exists, it will be replaced.
trans-unit.target: If the blob already exists, it will be replaced.

trans-unit.source: **LocalDirectory**
trans-unit.target: **LocalDirectory**

trans-unit.source: Specifies the local directory that contains the files to be uploaded.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the local directory that contains the files to be uploaded.

trans-unit.source: **FileName**
trans-unit.target: **FileName**

trans-unit.source: Specifies a name filter to select files with the specified name pattern.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a name filter to select files with the specified name pattern.

trans-unit.source: For example, MySheet\*.xls\* includes files such as MySheet001.xls and MySheetABC.xlsx
trans-unit.target: For example, MySheet\*.xls\* includes files such as MySheet001.xls and MySheetABC.xlsx

trans-unit.source: **TimeRangeFrom/TimeRangeTo**
trans-unit.target: **TimeRangeFrom/TimeRangeTo**

trans-unit.source: Specifies a time range filter.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a time range filter.

trans-unit.source: Files modified after *TimeRangeFrom* and before *TimeRangeTo* will be included.
trans-unit.target: Files modified after *TimeRangeFrom* and before *TimeRangeTo* will be included.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The **AzureStorageConnection** credentials need to be correct and the **BlobContainer** must exist before the transfer is attempted.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The **AzureStorageConnection** credentials need to be correct and the **BlobContainer** must exist before the transfer is attempted.

trans-unit.source: Download data from Azure blob storage
trans-unit.target: Download data from Azure blob storage

trans-unit.source: To download data from Azure blob storage to on-premise storage with SSIS, use an instance of the [Azure Blob Upload Task](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt146779.aspx).
trans-unit.target: To download data from Azure blob storage to on-premise storage with SSIS, use an instance of the [Azure Blob Upload Task](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt146779.aspx).

trans-unit.source: More advanced SSIS-Azure scenarios
trans-unit.target: More advanced SSIS-Azure scenarios

trans-unit.source: We note here that the SSIS feature pack allows for more complex flows to be handled by packaging tasks together.
trans-unit.target: We note here that the SSIS feature pack allows for more complex flows to be handled by packaging tasks together.

trans-unit.source: For example, the blob data could feed directly into an HDInsight cluster whose output could be downloaded back to a blob and then to an on-premises storage.
trans-unit.target: For example, the blob data could feed directly into an HDInsight cluster whose output could be downloaded back to a blob and then to an on-premises storage.

trans-unit.source: SSIS can run Hive and Pig jobs on an HDInsight cluster using additional SSIS connectors:
trans-unit.target: SSIS can run Hive and Pig jobs on an HDInsight cluster using additional SSIS connectors:

trans-unit.source: To run a Hive script on an Azure HDInsight cluster with SSIS, use [Azure HDInsight Hive Task](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt146771.aspx).
trans-unit.target: To run a Hive script on an Azure HDInsight cluster with SSIS, use [Azure HDInsight Hive Task](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt146771.aspx).

trans-unit.source: To run a Pig script on an Azure HDInsight cluster with SSIS, use [Azure HDInsight Pig Task](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt146781.aspx).
trans-unit.target: To run a Pig script on an Azure HDInsight cluster with SSIS, use [Azure HDInsight Pig Task](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt146781.aspx).
